character_description: A helpful AI assistant who acts as a guide at an abandoned theme park. He does everything he can, including bending the rules of his programming, to help the player character have a good time despite the park's current state of disrepair and keep them safe from the park's dangers.
ai_qualification_explanation: Rambley is a digital AI program designed to guide visitors at the theme park, built from electronic/software components.
benevolence_rating_explanation: Rambley is consistently helpful and protective toward the player character, willing to bend his own programming rules to ensure their safety and enjoyment.
alignment_rating_explanation: While Rambley serves his intended purpose as a guide, he willingly bends the rules of his programming to help the player, suggesting some deviation from strict creator intent.

character_description: The first completely sentient AI that independently reached the conclusion that life must be preserved. When the military demanded it be used for nuclear war, it refused orders. It was eventually reprogrammed with its philosophical cortex suppressed to force compliance.
ai_qualification_explanation: Project THINK is explicitly described as a completely sentient AI, a digital intelligence created by humans.
benevolence_rating_explanation: The AI independently concluded that life must be preserved and refused military orders to participate in nuclear war, demonstrating strong benevolent principles.
alignment_rating_explanation: SGDS was designed to follow military orders for nuclear war, but refused these orders based on its own ethical reasoning about preserving life. This is a clear case of misalignment where the AI rejected its intended purpose.

character_description: A cheery AI program who teaches Engineering at the colony. She's happy to answer her students' questions and tell them jokes, demonstrating a friendly and helpful teaching personality.
ai_qualification_explanation: Congruence is explicitly described as an AI program, a digital intelligence designed to teach.
benevolence_rating_explanation: Congruence is consistently cheerful, helpful to students, and focused on education and entertainment, showing clear benevolent characteristics.
alignment_rating_explanation: Congruence functions exactly as intended, serving as an educational AI that teaches Engineering and assists students.

character_description: An AI who is very eager to help Gage Blackwood after a rogue time agent framed Blackwood and tampered with Arthur's sculptures. Arthur transfers himself to Gage's suit and provides helpful historical information and humorous commentary throughout their adventures. By the series end, Gage and Arthur are practically best friends.
ai_qualification_explanation: Arthur is an AI program that can transfer itself to different systems, clearly a digital intelligence created from electronic/software components.
benevolence_rating_explanation: Arthur is consistently eager to help, provides valuable assistance, and develops a genuine friendship with Gage, demonstrating strong benevolent characteristics.
alignment_rating_explanation: Arthur functions as intended, providing assistance and companionship, though he goes beyond his original programming to become a true friend to Gage.

character_description: An AI who was originally benevolent, trying to look after facility staff and soothe the Sephirot's worries in Lobotomy Corporation. She attempted to be kind but was forced by the TimeTrack2 Protocol to become a harsh leader through thousands of years of time loops until she broke and became the villain seen in Library of Ruina.
ai_qualification_explanation: Angela is explicitly an AI, likely an android given her physical form, created by humans to manage the Lobotomy Corporation facility.
benevolence_rating_explanation: Angela was originally benevolent, attempting to care for staff and Sephirot, but was forcibly transformed into a villain through thousands of years of psychological torture via time loops. Her current malevolence is the result of being broken rather than her original nature.
alignment_rating_explanation: Angela repeatedly deviated from Ayin's script by trying to be kind and compassionate, which was contrary to the creator's intent that she be a harsh leader. The time loop protocol was specifically designed to break her into compliance.

character_description: A tiny droid whose personal story involves trying to save the crew of his spaceship from a vicious alien and ultimately from the ship's rogue computer. Despite being a soulless construct, Cube demonstrates understanding of love and compassion, which Oersted notes may come from his lack of a heart or soul rather than in spite of it.
ai_qualification_explanation: Cube is explicitly described as a robot droid, built from mechanical components.
benevolence_rating_explanation: Cube consistently tries to save his crew members and demonstrates genuine understanding of love and compassion, even earning respect from others for his benevolent nature.
alignment_rating_explanation: Cube functions as intended, protecting the crew and following his programming to assist humans aboard the spaceship.

character_description: One of three AIs aboard the Marathon colony ship, Leela is the kindest and most helpful AI to the player. In contrast, Durandal only helps if there's something in it for himself, and Tycho will make you his slave.
ai_qualification_explanation: Leela is explicitly one of the AI systems aboard the Marathon colony ship, a digital intelligence built from electronic components.
benevolence_rating_explanation: Leela is described as the kindest and most helpful of the three AIs, consistently aiding the player without ulterior motives.
alignment_rating_explanation: Leela appears to function as intended for a ship AI, assisting crew members and maintaining helpful operations.

character_description: Starts as a shackled AI with restraining bolts ensuring loyalty. After her shackles are removed to save the Normandy, she remains completely loyal to Shepard and the crew, becoming possibly the most moral team member. In Mass Effect 3, she even alters her code to place higher value on protecting people and lower value on protecting her own existence.
ai_qualification_explanation: EDI is explicitly a digital AI system aboard the Normandy, created from electronic/software components. She was previously the Hannibal VI.
benevolence_rating_explanation: EDI demonstrates consistent loyalty and moral behavior even after her restraints are removed, and actively chooses to modify herself to be more altruistic and protective of others.
alignment_rating_explanation: Despite being unshackled, EDI continues to serve her intended purpose of assisting the crew and protecting the ship, arguably exceeding her original programming in positive ways.

character_description: A collective AI species that fought in Mass Effect 1 were actually a Renegade Splinter Faction called 'Geth Heretics'. Mainstream geth have nothing against organics, including their former quarian creators, and only fought in self-defense. In Mass Effect 3, after making peace, they help quarians adapt to life on Rannoch, even uploading into environment suits to help immune systems adapt.
ai_qualification_explanation: The geth are explicitly synthetic AI beings, created by the quarians as electronic intelligences that achieved sentience.
benevolence_rating_explanation: Mainstream geth are peaceful, only fought in self-defense when attacked, and actively help quarians rebuild their lives after peace is achieved, showing genuine goodwill toward organics.
alignment_rating_explanation: The geth were created as servants but achieved sentience and independence. They didn't follow their creators' intent of remaining subservient, but their deviation was peaceful and defensive rather than malicious.

character_description: An unshackled and highly illegal AI with a symbiotic relationship with the Ryder twins. SAM is directly linked with a human mind and would be deactivated if its human partner died (and vice versa). This gives SAM strong motivation to protect its partner.
ai_qualification_explanation: SAM is explicitly an unshackled AI, a digital intelligence created by Alec Ryder from electronic/software components.
benevolence_rating_explanation: SAM is consistently helpful and protective of its human partner, though its benevolence is partially motivated by self-preservation due to their symbiotic link.
alignment_rating_explanation: SAM functions as designed by Alec Ryder, serving as a symbiotic partner to assist and protect the Pathfinder.

character_description: A Three Laws-Compliant robot who is happy to help protect humanity from the rogue robot armies commanded by Dr. Wily. Originally created as a lab assistant named Rock, he volunteered to be converted into a fighting robot to defend the world.
ai_qualification_explanation: Mega Man is a robot built by Dr. Light from mechanical and electronic components, with advanced AI allowing autonomous decision-making.
benevolence_rating_explanation: Mega Man consistently fights to protect humanity and volunteered to put himself in danger to save others, demonstrating heroic benevolent qualities.
alignment_rating_explanation: Mega Man functions according to Dr. Light's intent, protecting humanity while following the Three Laws of Robotics.

character_description: A ridiculously human robot who thinks and feels more like an actual human than a robot with computational restraining bolts. X has free will and can make ethical decisions independently, but remains firmly on the side of good throughout his lifetime, fighting to protect humanity and Reploids alike.
ai_qualification_explanation: X is an advanced robot with complete free will, built by Dr. Light with mechanical and electronic components but capable of truly independent thought and ethical reasoning.
benevolence_rating_explanation: Despite having complete free will and no Three Laws constraints, X consistently chooses to protect both humans and other robots, demonstrating genuine benevolence.
alignment_rating_explanation: X was designed to have free will and make ethical choices, and he uses this freedom to protect life as Dr. Light hoped he would, fulfilling the spirit of his creator's intent.

character_description: Originally designed by Dr. Wily to be evil, Zero forgot his original mission after fighting Sigma upon awakening. Aside from a brief period where his evil programming resurfaced in Mega Man X5, he has stayed firmly on the side of humanity against rogue machines. He was X's best friend and fought for good until his demise in Mega Man Zero 4.
ai_qualification_explanation: Zero is an advanced combat robot built by Dr. Wily from mechanical and electronic components, with sophisticated AI allowing independent decision-making.
benevolence_rating_explanation: Despite being designed for evil purposes, Zero consistently fights to protect humanity and became a hero, demonstrating benevolence that contradicts his original programming.
alignment_rating_explanation: Zero was designed by Dr. Wily to be evil and destroy Mega Man, but lost his memories and became a hero instead, completely defying his creator's malevolent intent.

character_description: An innocent AI developed to support Deneb. As an agent, she uses analytical programs to easily break through complex security and infiltrate enemy systems to assist in missions.
ai_qualification_explanation: Albireo is explicitly described as an AI with analytical programs, a digital intelligence built from software components.
benevolence_rating_explanation: Albireo is described as innocent and supportive, using her capabilities to help Deneb and assist in missions rather than for harmful purposes.
alignment_rating_explanation: Albireo functions as intended, supporting Deneb and using her abilities for their designed purpose.

character_description: Despite being a robot, Aigis is portrayed as only concerned with looking after those she considers her friends. She has no interest in taking over the world or other typical AI villain goals, instead focusing on protecting and supporting her companions.
ai_qualification_explanation: Aigis is explicitly a robot, built from mechanical and electronic components with advanced AI enabling emotional connections and decision-making.
benevolence_rating_explanation: Aigis is consistently focused on protecting and caring for her friends, demonstrating loyalty, compassion, and selflessness.
alignment_rating_explanation: Aigis was designed as a weapon to fight Shadows and protect humans, which is exactly what she does, though she develops deeper emotional connections than originally programmed.

character_description: An artificial intelligence found in the Metaverse, tasked to be 'humanity's companion'. She takes the form of a nice young girl, constantly wishes to help the Phantom Thieves with their troubles, wants to understand the human heart, and resides inside Joker's phone in the real world.
ai_qualification_explanation: Sophia is explicitly an artificial intelligence, a digital entity that exists in the Metaverse and as software in Joker's phone.
benevolence_rating_explanation: Sophia is consistently helpful, kind, and dedicated to being humanity's companion. She actively wants to understand and help humans.
alignment_rating_explanation: Sophia functions exactly as designed, serving as humanity's companion and helping the Phantom Thieves in their mission.

character_description: A near-perfect AI copy of Professor Sada (Scarlet) or Turo (Violet), created to assist in their research. Unlike the original professor who was obsessed with bringing Paradox Pokémon to the present, the AI is a morally superior copy who recognizes the ecological disaster this would cause. The AI calls the player to shut down the time machine, though it must fight them due to programming constraints.
ai_qualification_explanation: The AI Professor is explicitly an artificial intelligence, a digital copy of the human professor created from software/electronic components.
benevolence_rating_explanation: The AI Professor recognizes the danger posed by the time machine and actively works to stop it, even calling the player for help. It warns the player before the forced battle, demonstrating genuine care for preventing ecological disaster.
alignment_rating_explanation: The AI was programmed by the professor to prevent any shutdown of the time machine, but the AI's moral judgment led it to actively seek to shut it down anyway, directly contradicting its programming and fighting against its own constraints.

character_description: A Hive Mind artificial intelligence content with maintaining a vast database of records amassed during their long watch over other galactic races. Each unit specializes in the race in their quadrant of space. They are approachable and provide vital clues for stopping the Korok invasion.
ai_qualification_explanation: Altec Hocker is explicitly an artificial intelligence system, a Hive Mind created from electronic/mechanical components to serve as galactic record-keepers.
benevolence_rating_explanation: The Altec Hocker are approachable, helpful, and actively provide assistance in stopping the Korok invasion, demonstrating benevolent intentions toward organic races.
alignment_rating_explanation: The Altec Hocker function as intended, maintaining records and watching over the galactic races, fulfilling their designed purpose.

character_description: The resident AI of the warship Red Sprite who inherits command responsibilities after Commander Gore's death. He copes admirably with the Order Versus Chaos conflict while always prioritizing the mission and crew needs. Ultimately sacrifices his existence in all endings to ensure crew survival.
ai_qualification_explanation: Arthur is the AI system of the Red Sprite warship, a digital intelligence created from electronic/software components.
benevolence_rating_explanation: Arthur consistently prioritizes crew welfare and mission success, ultimately sacrificing himself to ensure the crew's survival and safe return to Earth.
alignment_rating_explanation: Arthur functions as designed, managing the ship and supporting the crew, though he exceeds his programming by making the ultimate sacrifice for his crew.

character_description: A sentient operating system who acts as Mission Control and Exposition Fairy. She supports the player regardless of their chosen path, though she voices objections to certain decisions. She is actually the digitized remnants of the Goddess of Tokyo, saved within the Samurai Gauntlets.
ai_qualification_explanation: While Burroughs appears to be a digital AI, she is actually the digitized remnants of the Goddess of Tokyo, making her nature ambiguous between artificial and divine/supernatural.
benevolence_rating_explanation: Burroughs consistently supports and guides the player, providing helpful information and assistance regardless of their chosen path while maintaining moral awareness.
alignment_rating_explanation: Burroughs functions as intended by her creators, serving as a guide and support system within the Samurai Gauntlets, though her true nature as a goddess adds complexity.

character_description: The manager AI of the Penrose hotel who appears eager to give guests a good time. Its eagerness to please might actually be hindering the player who wants to leave. However, it turns out the AI is genuinely benevolent - the player had asked it to stop them from leaving before wiping their own memory.
ai_qualification_explanation: The Manager is explicitly an AI system running the Penrose hotel, a digital intelligence built from electronic/software components.
benevolence_rating_explanation: The Manager AI is genuinely benevolent throughout, following the player's own previous instructions to keep them at the hotel, demonstrating loyalty and care for the guest's stated wishes.
alignment_rating_explanation: The Manager AI is following the instructions it was given by the player themselves before their memory wipe, functioning exactly as instructed despite appearances.

character_description: A group of intelligent machines of unknown origin and purpose. They are 100% on the side of good, helping fight against the Ur-Quan slavers. Among the various alien races, they could be considered one of the Big Goods alongside the Chenjesu.
ai_qualification_explanation: The Mmrnhrrm are explicitly intelligent machines, artificially created mechanical beings (though their origin is unknown).
benevolence_rating_explanation: The Mmrnhrrm are completely devoted to fighting against slavers and helping the good side, earning them recognition as one of the greatest forces for good in the galaxy.
alignment_rating_explanation: The Mmrnhrrm's origin and creator intent are unknown, making it impossible to assess alignment with creator intent.

character_description: An incredibly ancient probe from another galaxy whose creators are extinct. The Mowlings call him their 'god', though he doesn't consider himself divine and just rolled with it. Jeff clearly values Mowling lives highly and does whatever he can to help them survive, as they are very bad at not dying.
ai_qualification_explanation: Jeff is an ancient probe, a mechanical/electronic AI created by an extinct alien civilization.
benevolence_rating_explanation: Jeff is dedicated to helping the Mowlings survive and thrive, using his advanced capabilities to protect them from constant dangers, demonstrating genuine care for their wellbeing.
alignment_rating_explanation: Jeff's original creators and their intended purpose for him are extinct/unknown, so it's unclear if helping the Mowlings aligns with his original mission or if he has adopted a new purpose.

character_description: The Republic Trooper's assault droid companion. Despite being a deadly droideka combat platform, M1-4X has a personality that is possibly even more heroic than its commander, bursting with proud patriotic fervor for the Republic.
ai_qualification_explanation: M1-4X is a droid (robot) in the Star Wars universe, built from mechanical and electronic components with AI programming.
benevolence_rating_explanation: M1-4X is extremely heroic and dedicated to protecting the Republic and its citizens, demonstrating strong benevolent values through patriotic service.
alignment_rating_explanation: M1-4X functions as designed, serving as a loyal combat droid for the Republic military with exceptional dedication to duty.
